title: The Nordic Road and Transport Research Program enters its 5th year

author: Anders HH Jansson, Finnra - Finnish Road Administration

segmentation: We are looking forward for your presentation.
Thank you.
There is perhaps a slight.
Changing gear, but actually in this program, which I'll be referring there, is a pavement performance modeling component which perhaps gets rather close to what we just heard about, but.
What I'm want to talk about is Nordic Research Road and Transport Research Program, which now has been operating for almost five years.
It's based on the fact that Nordic Rd experts have been cooperating for many, many, many years.
The Nordic Rd Association was founded in the 19th.
But this Corporation has always been fairly ad hoc, especially in research areas and as new partners kept coming in, especially through the European Union, there was a need.
To develop a stronger, more effective structure for the way research was organized in the Nordic countries.
So our Director general in 2004 made an agreement framework agreement or road and transport research and development.
The node for Van traffic agreement.
The idea, naturally to strengthen scientific and technological contributions within the sphere of authority of these Rd administrations.
It's.
Simple Corporation model we have used in this North fo two or more Rd authorities may agree.
On project of ownership.
.1 is that they disseminate one.
Of them.
Of this as project responsible.
Yesterday at the Aromat Rd presentation you heard more about the common obligation and common pot models.
I will not go into the details of those here.
I think I may be using the wrong term here.
When I call this model, the common obligation model.
I've never been quite yet, but the idea is that the responsible administration, the one that has been decided, designator responsible, handles all financing.
All invoicing makes all contracts.
But regardless of where, for instance, the consultant is working and overseas all outputs.
But the results are owned by the participating authorities and the results are disseminated to all contract authorities.
We started fairly slow.
We have only been going on with five projects by now.
One do N 2000 Rd engineering model and noise Model project was finalized in 2006.
We have three ongoing projects, one on bridge Lifecycle Optimist.
Optimization it will be ending in 2009.
One non disturbance from lighting during Rd works at night.
Having to do Rd works at Night is a fairly new phenomenon in the Scandinavian Nordic countries.
That is just now ending and one on.
As I said, pavement performance modeling, which is will be going on for a couple of years.
Just now a project on bridges without waterproofing has started.
We have lots of project ideas under preparation.
For instance for Rd surface texture for low low noise and low rolling resistance.
Panel safety evaluation.
And.
One that is.
A really thorny problem.
How do you specify?
How do you make functional specifications for the end of your contract.
When you are doing real long 25 year PPP projects?
The public private partnerships?
What are you going to say about what kind of a road do you want to have in 25 years?
What are the functional specification for that and that is of course another interesting thing to ask.
The answer I don't know.
At.
But all the time, there are many ideas that never show up as projects.
On average, 10 and every year go somewhere else.
But it's different reasons climate change.
Never showed up as a new FO project.
And that was simply because it was too big.
Norway proposed it and they wanted us to do it together, but then they notice that their own climate change effort demanded so much resources they couldn't say spare any for the Corporation.
But then there we shifted gear, so now that is actually within Iran at Rd.
Which AT and you start there.
So we think that that is quite.
That's a very good development action, but then there was, for instance, a projective safer roadside geometry.

The idea about the forgiving Rd of not every mistake leading to a fatality, but there it took us so long to set up the Corporation that the national projects were far, far beyond before we got so far, so it was not no use.
And then for many other ideas, it's very difficult to express them in a way that really engages the interests of other countries.
You have to be so very clear.
And that is not a thing that we really are used to.
And in many cases our project managers are not quite willing to come out and say really clearly what is it they are looking for.
And of course, if they can't say that, then we can't go out and ask people.
Do you want to join?
So the ideas that have been easiest to implement orders that have been based on previous complementation cooperation.

For instance, this on noise modeling we have been working together or noise modeling since the 1970s, so it was very easy to set up a project and we're actually setting up several other projects in slightly other contexts to follow up on that.
So few words of the modes of operation.
We have very simple system.
We have a steering group I'm a member of that with meets once a year.
A preparatory group meets 2 three times a year.
There is a lead country which chairs both groups and holds the secretariat.
At.
And research priority list is checked up annually.
Then there is a set of standard project and program documents.
And their website.
Www.nudefororg, which is then used for dissemination and for Contacts.
Finance.
Sing it's by a designated share, not binding.
We are not saying that yes, we are going to spend 1,000,000 on this for the next year or something like that, but we put in an average framework on what we want.
We do not use this as some kind of additional research and development funding.
It comes out of the same pot.
But we cannot use it as an indication.
This is the space we have.
Average annual level for each country by now is around 200,000 euro.
It's fairly modest.
This is only costs procurement of research and consultants.
And this is generally shared equally, but Iceland very often has a slightly lower share because it's very much smaller country than the other participants.
Administrations, of course, but in lots of own resource work and they carry their own costs.
For instance, for secretary at that there is no.
No invoicing for that.
The total project volume just now is a little less than 2 million euro, which means about 50,000 euro per project and participating country.
So today we have a stable program.
It's strongly linked to the way Rd administration's work.
We have a good connection to the Nordic Rd Association and it's getting better.
Also just now because the Association is developing its own strategy.
At.
It's included in the way the other messages make their research and development policy.
We are getting a better methodology.
This is a process of course for how to cooperate.
We have a process which.
Passess it's very good to have standard elements in the process you you go in, you take out a word format for contract and there it is.
You don't have to start doing very complicated speculations.
So what do we need to do?
First of all, we need to get a better flow.
We have
Slow just now, as I said with this one project, the national project.
Past our own preparation so it may be useless.
We need to get a better flow.
We need to get.
Continuous input flow.
We need to make our own project managers familiar with the methods.
And actually not the worst job is trying to find these common interest projects, get them clearly expressed, and that's that's tough.
But we got a good perspective.
Very strong one.
Becausw, especially of course seal from say I finished perspective a very small very peripheral country with very bad level of resources for research.
We must succeed in our international cooperation.
Otherwise we can't handle what's coming up.
So we'd better learn how to do it.
And we have moved forward traffic as a fantastic working pepease chair here in the beginning said that it might be a good.
Good pilot for regional development.
I'm quite the same opinion.
It is a good pilot.
It teaches you humility, at least simplicity.
And we are getting, I think, also towards an increasing integration with the kind of structures created by Aaron at Rd.
Which again naturally is the next step in our perspectives.
Thank you.
